result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrelle L Grice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrelle L Grice in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing.  Court imposed the following sentence:

    The Defendant was given the following: AS TO EACH COUNT AND TO RUN CONCURRENT WITH EACH OTHER

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2  YEAR(S); CONCURRENT

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No violent contact with the victim
*Domestic/Anger Management counseling

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 EACH COUNT (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE OF $100.00 AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME AS TO COUNT 1:   4 months huber, STAYED the last 2 months; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  
18 days credit. Sentence to commence 09/01/2015 by 6 pm

Sentence/Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County.

Apply any cash bail that is posted.
Sentencing hearing on August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Montrelle L Grice in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Court orally amends repeater enhancer language and statute number on Counts #1-3 on amended information filed. Defendant enters a guity plea to Counts #1-3 on amended information.  Court orders state to file a 2nd amended information within 10 days.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1-3 on amended information.  Attorney Weathers requests a later sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montrelle L Grice in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Weathers requests the court modify bail for the victim and defendant to have contact for their childs one year birthday.
Statement by victim requesting no contact be lifted.  
State notes it's concerns.
Additional statements by Atty. Weathers.  
The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.
for bail reduction or modification filed by Attorney Weathers.

Defendant Montrelle L Grice in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for preliminary hearing.  Witness has been sequestered.  City of Waukesha police officer Ryan Bukouras sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Boese.  Cross examination by Attorney Weathers.  City of Waukesha police officer Michael Underwood sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Boese.  Cross examination by Attorney Weathers.  Redirect by Attorney Boese.  Recross by Attorney Weathers.  State rests and moves for bind over.   Attorney Weathers objects.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
